caption.title:
Symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals during foodborne norovirus-outbreaks in Japan from 2005 through 2006.â€¨Extracted from Ozawa et al (2007).
31 Setting No. corresponds to identity numbers given by original research. No. of individuals stands for the total number of individuals diagnosed by stool specimen test at each outbreak setting. Left five bars show the genogroup I (GI)-associated outbreaks. Other 50 bars show the genogroup II (GII)-associated outbreaks, and middle of them emphasize outbreaks caused by the genogroup II type 4 (GII4) norovirus, which is the most dominant among genotypes extracted from acute gastroenteritis patients.
